content:
During my Subcommittee on Economic and Consumer Policy hearing, we heard from the President of an Organ Procurement Organization who has spent company funds on NFL tickets and retreats to Napa Valley. Unacceptable.

content:
Today, the Subcommittee on Elections, led by Chairman G. K. Butterfield, held a hearing entitled, "Voting In America: The Potential For Voter List Purges To Interfere With Free And Fair Access To The Ballot."

During his opening remarks, Chairman Butterfield said, "The testimony provided today will help guide us as this Committee seeks to understand what needs to be done to ensure that voter list maintenance efforts are nondiscriminatory and do not erroneously remove properly registered voters."

Read more about this hearing at https://cha.house.gov/committee-activity/hearings/voting-america-potential-voter-list-purges-interfere-free-and-fair
name: Committee on House Administration - Democrats
text: today subcommittee elections led chairman g k butterfield held hearing entitled voting america potential voter list purges interfere free fair access ballotduring opening remarks chairman butterfield said testimony provided today help guide us committee seeks understand needs done ensure voter list maintenance efforts nondiscriminatory erroneously remove properly registered votersread hearing
